intro: Galium moranii subsp. aculeolatum, commonly known as the aculeolate bedstraw, is a flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its slender stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers clustered in dense inflorescences. It is native to certain regions of southern Africa and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Its subspecies status reflects distinct morphological features that set it apart from other members of the Galium moranii species complex.
